story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in the Philippines, there lived a little girl named Maria. Maria was a kind and curious child with a heart as big as the sun in the sky. Every night, before bedtime, Maria's grandmother would tell her magical stories about the stars in the sky and the creatures that roamed the forest.

One night, as Maria lay in her bed, she gazed out of her window and saw a bright star twinkling in the sky. She whispered a wish to the star, "Starlight, star bright, first star I see tonight, I wish I could visit the magical forest and meet the creatures that live there."

The next morning, Maria woke up to the sound of birds chirping and the sun shining brightly. She remembered her wish and decided to explore the forest near her village. As she walked through the trees, she heard giggling and rustling in the bushes. Curious, Maria followed the sound until she reached a clearing where she saw a group of colorful butterflies flitting around a flower garden.

The butterflies saw Maria and invited her to dance and play with them. Maria laughed and twirled around, feeling like she was flying with the butterflies. As the sun began to set, the butterflies thanked Maria for bringing joy to their garden and led her back to the edge of the forest.

As Maria returned home, she felt grateful for the magical adventure she had experienced. She climbed into bed, closed her eyes, and drifted off to sleep with a smile on her face, dreaming of the friends she had made in the enchanted forest.

And so, every night, Maria would close her eyes, remembering the butterflies and the magical forest, knowing that the wonders of the world were always within reach for those with a kind heart and a curious spirit.

The end. Goodnight, sweet dreams, little one.
